geography.description: The capital city of Arabasta, built on a plateau near an oasis in the northeast part of the kingdom. An extremely large city built on a huge rock with five long flights of stairs providing access.
notableFeatures: Five entrance stairways (west, southwest, south, southeast, east)
Round city plan similar to Abbasid-era Iraq
Islamic-inspired architecture with domed buildings and towers

keyMoments.title: Usopp and Chopper Defeat Baroque Works Agents
keyMoments.description: In the streets of Alubarna, Usopp and Chopper successfully defeat Mr. 4, Miss Merry Christmas, and Lassou.
keyMoments.significance: First major Straw Hat victory in Alubarna, removing Baroque Works agents from the conflict.

keyMoments.title: Sanji vs Mr. 2 Throughout South Block
keyMoments.description: Sanji and Mr. 2 Bon Kurei battle intensely through Alubarna's South Block, with their fight destroying buildings.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases the scale of battles occurring throughout the capital during the civil war.

culturalSignificance: Capital city of Arabasta, rich in culture and history. The center of the kingdom's government and royal family.

historicalNotes.note: Access to the city is through five long flights of stairs located at different cardinal directions
The southern gate is considered the main entrance
City plan follows Islamic architectural conventions similar to historical Baghdad

geography.description: The royal palace located in the center of Alubarna where the royal family and their servants live. Said to predate the Kingdom of Arabasta itself.

keyMoments.title: Vivi Arrives at the Palace
keyMoments.description: Princess Vivi reaches the palace and finds Commander Chaka, marking a critical turning point.
keyMoments.significance: The rightful princess returns to the heart of power during the kingdom's crisis.

keyMoments.title: Vivi Orders Palace Destruction
keyMoments.description: Vivi requests the destruction of the 4000-year-old palace to stop the civil war.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Vivi's willingness to sacrifice the kingdom's most sacred monument to save her people.

culturalSignificance: The most sacred and historically significant structure in Arabasta, symbolizing the kingdom's heritage and royal authority.

historicalNotes.note: The palace is approximately 4000 years old, predating the Kingdom of Arabasta itself
Vivi is willing to destroy it to save her people, showing the palace is less important than lives
